featured.text: Then they wanted to put him in jail and charged him with violation of law for climbing the building without a permit.

In medieval Europe, on the other hand, travel documents were issued by local authorities, and generally contained a list of towns and cities which the document holder was permitted to enter or pass through.
Thus, only the government was permitted to produce the alcohol.
Only people who paid their taxes were permitted to travel to different regions of the Caliphate.

definition.en_def: To allow or give permission for something; a document granting permission.
definition.example: You need a permit to park in this area.
